item.title: Data Analytics Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analytics Analyst

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals.  These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms.  Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s).  Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit.  Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions.  Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

What will you do?

Analytics Lab Support

  • Assist in the creation and maintenance of foundational data & analytics initiatives that provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned in the platform(s).
  • Support effective delivery of a pipeline of data analytics and automation initiatives that impact Audit execution activities globally across all regions and lines of business.
  • Acts as a peer to the Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the centralized Data Management & Analytics team (DMA).
  • Empowered to challenge and refine the value of analytics ideas as proposed by the auditors.

Business Case Development and Adoption Support

  • Conduct research and identify opportunities for improving processes and technology: Externally, research best practices, emerging risks, and innovation across RBC and broadly throughout the financial sector. Internally, gather, understand, and analyse auditors’ pain points.
  • Size potential upside of deploying a solution across platforms, in line with your findings. In partnership with technical experts and other stakeholders, define and articulate ROI for your business cases for Executive Selection Committee approval.
  • Support technical builds and process reengineering aligned with business cases at every step of analytics lifecycle; engage auditors as needed and support user acceptance testing across your platforms.
  • Support the communication of ongoing work to broad Internal Audit audience and support creation of training materials and experiences for selected tools.

Technological use and Reuse

  • Support the adoption of centrally developed data products in the platform with support from the DMA team.
  • Support global adoption of IA wide data initiatives.
  • Support technology use and reuse by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the Internal Audit toolkit.
  • Assist in review of quarterly Audit plan for existing tool use to reduce duplication of efforts and to ensure technology provides expected return.
  • Support gathering and triage feedback for technical experts on an ongoing basis.

Leadership & People Development

  • Mentor team members - assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects.
  • Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors.

What do you need to succeed?

Overall

  • Good understanding of programming languages (Python, SQL, R)
  • Strong understanding and experience using data visualization tools
  • Strong understanding of Data Analytics to optimize use
  • Knowledge of financial industry regulatory guidelines
  • Knowledge of auditing principles and techniques
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in project management
  • Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment.

Technical experience:

  • Proven ability to produce, conduct, and report on internal and external research, including qualitative and quantitative metrics
  • Demonstrated ability to calculate ROI for projects of various complexity and scale
  • Working knowledge of Python, SQL, Data Visualization, UX/UI
  • Working knowledge of Agile or other lean methodologies
  • Working knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data technologies
  • Proficient analytical and problem solving skills
  • Proficient data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Proficient data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • Experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark

Leadership and People Management experience:

  • Demonstrates they have successfully worked in inclusive and diverse work teams
  • Proven ability to multitask and prioritize activities; across borders and cultures
  • Experience working as a team member on a special project, over an extended period of time

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $65,000 - $105,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

USAUDIT23

Job Summary

Assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals. These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms. Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.

Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s). Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit. Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions. Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit. Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-01-12-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-03-07-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​

item.title: Senior Analytics Manager
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Analytics Manager

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

To be a part of a global, exciting and forward-thinking Data Products team within Internal Audit that are focused on building insight-driven applications to provide enhanced assurance across Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) & Internal Audit Shared Services. As RBC continues to evolve in response to new challenges that impact financial markets across the globe, Internal Audit have been proactive in transforming their approach from traditional auditing, to data-informed decision making when assessing and challenging the management of risk across the business.

The RBC CAE Group leverages a unique perspective— with a coordinated view across the entire business—to deliver valuable advice that not only gives assurance, but that illuminates a bigger picture, connects dots, builds best practices and broadens possibilities. We connect intelligence to protect and enable RBC.

What will you do?

  • Apply your skills in data exploration, statistical analysis and machine learning on a diverse range of data sources to identify insights and opportunities to develop data products.
  • Use your curiosity and own initiative to develop innovative solutions to a wide and ever-changing set of complex problems across RBC.
  • Automate and productionize the testing of key business and IT controls to enable auditors in continuously monitoring key risks across the enterprise.
  • Collaborate with other data analysts, data engineers, data product leads and data scientists within Internal Audit to scale your ideas from concept to production.
  • Help develop the vision for automated control test and process enhancements, supporting with the development of business cases, development requirements, product roadmaps, and product backlogs.
  • Take ownership in driving the Data Products strategy across a wide portfolio of internal audit.
  • Design, develop and maintain productionized applications and dashboards for our end users.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have

  • Degree in a quantitative field, and experience with either Python or R as well as SQL
  • Experience building natural language processing (NLP) and unsupervised learning models
  • Strong grasp of fundamentals in statistics (hypothesis testing, regression, inference)
  • Ability to own and manage a backlog, with a value-based understanding of all stakeholders. Excellent collaborator and stakeholder management experience.
  • Demonstrated experience exploring large, complex datasets for the purpose of anomaly detection and latent pattern recognition

Nice to have

  • Experience developing interactive and sophisticated dashboards in Tableau (or similar tool) and experience working with Dataiku
  • Understanding of software engineering design principles
  • Demonstrated experience building strong relationships and communicating effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Project Management Experience and Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt or equivalent in process improvement

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Flexible work/life balance options

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-NS-BEDFORD, CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Regular

item.title: Manager, Stress Testing Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Stress Testing Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As part of the Group Risk Management team, the Associate Director, Stress Testing Analytics will implement stress testing components and participate in risk management analytics and processes to minimize credit risk. The ideal candidate will apply extensive, in-depth knowledge, skills, and practices to perform complex assignments.

What will you do?

  • Develops and maintains tools used for the implementation and execution of credit risk models. These models are used in the measurement of Expected Credit Loss (ECL), Provision for Credit Losses, and RWA for internal and regulatory stress testing.
  • Execute the production of stress testing projections for internal and regulatory filings.
  • Identify ECL production challenges and conducts independent problem solving to resolve proficiently.
  • Communicate results and analyses to management and key stakeholders.

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have:

  • Experience with SAS & Python programming
  • Experience with data analytics
  • Knowledge of credit products in the financial industry

Nice-to-Have:

  • Familiarity with statistical modelling of credit products
  • Experience with stress testing programs in the financial industry

​

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking, to keep growing, and working together to build and deliver trusted reporting to help our stakeholders succeed and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Job Summary

Monitors market risk and implements risk management systems and processes to minimize any risk to the market. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

Canada

item.title: VP/Senior Manager- Cash Management Product Pricing and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

VP/Senior Manager- Cash Management Product Pricing and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The role will develop and oversee the pricing strategy of payment products for US cash management. Collaborating with sales and product partners and utilizing an agile delivery approach, the incumbent will develop payments pricing proposals across a suite of payment products (e.g. Fedwire/ ACH/FX etc.) and formulate pricing strategies to support optimization of revenues, while having a strong pulse on client needs, industry trends and competitor landscape

US Cash Management USCM) Business is a unique opportunity to build the cash management business of the future from the ground up. This is an exciting time to join a start-up function within RBC, built from scratch and anchored in a technical/digital play vs. a traditional play, enabling RBC to compete with new entrants in this space!

What will you do?

  • Collaborate with Sales and Product partners to develop comprehensive payments pricing proposals, subject to senior management approval
  • Develop a relationship pricing approach to increase market share and revenues while focusing on client profitability.
  • Conduct competitive analysis and gather market intelligence to inform pricing strategy.
  • Manage relationships with Solutions-based clients and achieve revenue growth.
  • Develop client strategy reviews and plans in consultation with relevant stakeholders.
  • Achieve business plan by executing individual and regional sales plans and delivering business advice and new insights to clients.
  • Work on cash management models to simulate deal economics based on different KPIs and identify potential re-pricing/up-pricing opportunities to optimize portfolio profitability

People Leadership & Collaboration

  • Selects, builds, and leads a high performing deposits pricing team, leveraging individual capabilities and strengths
  • Provides coaching, mentoring and professional development that further embeds the right culture, values, and leadership behaviors
  • Works with team members to establish goals, drive performance management, support career development and reward strong performance.
  • Ability to forge strong relationships and routines with cross functional partners to drive strong business outcomes 

What you need to succeed?

  • At least 5 years of experience in the financial industry, with preference in Cash Management or Transaction Banking.
  • In-depth knowledge of payment products such as SWIFT, Fedwire, ACH, RTP or FX
  • Familiarity with innovative technologies and current technology trends, particularly in the digital product space such as host to host, API, SWIFT, and TMS/ERP integration
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to see tasks through to completion without significant guidance
  • A "can do" attitude and a client-centric mindset in product design
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to clearly articulate to all project members and stakeholders
  • Experience to deliver significant business results and managing projects from scoping to conclusion, while consistently keeping the client’s goals in mind.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Flexible work/life balance options

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $150,000- $200,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

Job Summary

item.title: Sr. Manager, Reporting & Analytics - USCM Tech
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager, Reporting & Analytics - USCM Tech

Job Description


RBC has made the strategic decision to become a Disruptor in the U.S. Cash Management space. By starting this journey, there is a significant opportunity to evolve and capitalize on a $100 Billion Dollar market segment in the U.S. In support of this vision, RBC aims to offer a frictionless, embedded payment and liquidity experience for its clients.  While RBC has an established Cash Management business in Canada, the U.S. based group will be built from scratch and anchored in a technical/digital play vs. a traditional play, enabling the Bank to compete with new entrants in this space.

What is the opportunity?

The US Cash Management (USCM) Technology team is undertaking a green field project to build a brand-new system to serve corporate clients. In this role, you will be responsible for the overall collection, accuracy, and reporting of USCM Tech initiatives. ​

Identifies and collects data sources, analyzes and extracts key data and information, evaluates and monitors data quality to meet the organization\'s information system needs and requirements. Applies advanced in-depth and/or broad knowledge, considered a top resource across the organization.


What will you do?

  • Reporting and Shared Knowledge:
    • Manage the USCM Tech reporting calendar
    • Prepare routine internal portfolio reporting for team leadership on initiative status (financials, risks, benefits)
    • Coordinate portfolio reporting to senior executives (incl. T&O, Group Heads, Board of Directors, etc.)
    • Administer and maintain tools environment for enterprise reporting on behalf of USCM Tech team
    • Ensure consistent reporting processes, approach and tools are in place (factoring in regional differences)
    • Update tools and sites to support shared knowledge and ensure adherence and use of standardized tools and process
  • Data Analytics
    • Subject Matter Expert on gathering development of reporting tools, quality control and measurement of data.
    • Responsible for bringing leading industry best practices into reporting and analytics design solutions for USCM Tech to the table for senior management to review
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvements
  • Relationship and Communication
    • Provides executives and senior management with timely updates on project issues and manages communications including status reports
    • Effectively communicates and builds rapport with team members, stakeholders and interface groups across USCM using a variety of techniques and collaboration from initiation to close
    • Interacts with executives and senior management on the full range of matters related to USCM Tech reporting and analytics
  • Operational Risk, Compliance and Audits
    • Ensures operational risk activities are effectively managed and addressed.
    • Proactively monitors and ensures risk management deadlines are met and issues resolved on a timely basis.

Must have:

  • Experience with financial operations
  • 7+ years of project management experience with at least 3-5 years’ experience with large projects portfolios
  • Demonstrated data analytic & reporting experience
    • Experience using Tableau, SharePoint, Microsoft Office suite, JIRA and Confluenence
  • Strong client-focus and responsiveness to business needs
    • Experience in dashboard development
  • Well-developed communication and presentation skills including executive interaction

Nice to have:

  • PMP Certified or equivalent
  • Basic financial accounting knowledge
  • Exposure to financial services and/or financial products.

What\'s in It for You?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Positive work culture emphasizing diversity and inclusion, volunteerism, and community involvement
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including great benefits, annual incentive program and recognition
  • Leaders who support your development
  • A dynamic, collaborative, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and grow your career
  • Work-life integration

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Technology and Operations

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

2023-02-24-08:00

2023-02-27-08:00

item.title: Associate, Institutional Client Credit Management - Portfolio Management & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate, Institutional Client Credit Management - Portfolio Management & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will play a key role in the risk assessment and continuous risk monitoring for RBC Capital Markets and RBC Investor & Treasury Services with asset managers, including mutual funds, UCITS, managed accounts and hedge funds.
 

Ensure all credit limit systems are properly recording approvals and assist in the preparation of timely management information reports

What will you do?

  • Prepare borrower/counterparty risk analysis and propose internal ratings
  • Undertake annual reviews on a timely basis and be compliant with deadlines
  • Understand and assess risks inherent in (i) the asset management industry and its regulation, (ii) the sponsors and the markets they operate in, (iii) products and (iv) investment strategies
  • Undertake other primary responsibilities that may arise from time to time in support of risk assessment and continuous monitoring.
  • Ensure timely completion of investment manager annual reviews and RAFs for a portfolio of counterparties
  • Ensure timely completion of counterparty RAF reviews in line with the Investment Management review schedule
  • Perform effective risk analysis that contributes to a portfolio-wide risk profile that meets RBC’s risk appetite for the sector.
  • Accurately maintain limit data within CCMS
  • Participate in client due diligence meetings
  • Overdraft excess monitoring on T+1 basis for ITS
  • NAV collection, reporting, analysis and NAV ATE waiver completion
  • Contribute to Monthly Watchlist and ad-hoc risk reporting.
  • Maintain a strong understanding of RBC credit policies and guidelines
  • Complete assigned projects and other duties in an efficient and effective manner that supports business initiatives

What you need to succeed?

  • Undergrad in business, finance or economics or equivalent

  • At least 3 years financial work experience

  • Understanding and knowledge of fund industry and securities regulations governing funds

  • Self - starter with strong organizational and time management skills

  • Ability to establish priorities, multi-task with accompanying attention to detail

  • Ability to interpret, explain and communicate opinions and recommendations using strong verbal and written skills

  • Problem solving skills. Technical Familiarity and basic understanding of I&TS  and Capital Markets products including FX, swaps, custody

  • Understanding of credit risk

  • Advanced data and computer management skills including proficiency with Excel


What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities 

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Flexible work/life balance options

item.title: Senior Manager, Data & Analytics, ESG Centre of Excellence, Internal Audit
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data & Analytics, ESG Centre of Excellence, Internal Audit

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

As part of the Environmental, Social, Governance Centre of Excellence (ESG COE) in RBC’s Internal Audit team, you will play a role in assessing how environmental and social (E&S) risks are being managed, and the effectiveness of related controls. You will assess the design and operating effectiveness of key climate and E&S risk-related controls and initiatives through testing and evaluating research, data analytics and insights. A significant focus of this role will be testing data and controls related to the calculation of RBC’s financed emissions across different asset classes within carbon-intensive sectors, and tracking progress on net-zero emissions reduction targets.

The RBC CAE Group leverages a unique perspective— with a coordinated view across the entire business—to deliver valuable advice that not only gives assurance, but that illuminates a bigger picture, connects dots, builds best practices and broadens possibilities. We connect intelligence to protect and enable RBC.

What will you do?

  • Source, assess, validate, and visualize data used for climate and social risk measurement, and work with the Director, ESG COE, and use this data to inform actionable steps in advising internal stakeholders on management and monitoring of E&S risk.
  • With a risk and controls-focused mindset, identify opportunities to assess and challenge E&S risk data processes and controls, and make recommendations for implementing improvements.
  • Assess data quality and results obtained from public and private data sources work with internal stakeholders to improve our climate risk measurement and management capabilities.
  • Work with diverse internal stakeholders across business lines and functions to share assessments of E&S risk data and insights, contribute to improving E&S risk management and controls, business strategy, and ESG and climate disclosures.  
  • Assess RBC’s capabilities in measuring financed emissions, setting net-zero targets and delivering carbon accounting insights across the enterprise.
  • Contribute to and lead the development and delivery of presentations and reports.
  • Lead workstreams and collaborations across multiple teams in order to accomplish the above.

Must have

  • Undergraduate degree in a quantitative discipline or similar.
  • Experience working in an analytics team, especially those tasked with solving difficult and/or vaguely-defined problems, and an advanced understanding of coding, programming and querying languages, including SQL and Python.
  • Experience developing presentations, visualizations and dashboards for executives and an interest in developing advanced analytical capabilities; excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Demonstrated ability in mathematical, statistical, financial or economic analyses on large, complex datasets and in translating data into business insights and storytelling.
  • A desire and proven ability to build new and innovative approaches to complex problems with minimal direction.
  • Commitment to quality and accuracy with a high level of attention to detail.

Nice to have

  • Master of Management Analytics degree; CFA, CMA or CPA; audit or compliance experience. Knowledge of climate change science with experience in the development and use of climate and economic scenarios, models, projections and data; knowledge or familiarity with the climate risk and/or target setting guidance issued by PCAF, NZBA, TCFD, ISSB, and/or OSFI (B-15).
  • Experience with or interest in agile or design thinking methodologies or frameworks.
  • Knowledge and experience in quantitative model development, testing and validation.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-04-28

Application Deadline:

2023-05-13

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

item.title: Manager, Program Governance
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Program Governance

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Manager, Program Governance, you will support the delivery of analytical insights for Global Finance IT and build interactive and intuitive dashboards to model data. This role will also be responsible for the oversight of project management tools to ensure appropriate IT cost recovery to various lines of businesses. You will report on various key performance indicators to Senior Management related to financial health and resource capacity trends. In addition, you will work intimately with project managers to leverage best practices on project expenditure management.

What will you do?

  • Provide administration for Finance IT’s project management tools (Planview/MIS) for Finance IT’s development and maintenance portfolio of $100mm+, including the creation/upkeep/closure of projects, population of key data attributes, and ensuring proper cost recovery of all IT personnel
  • Support project managers and delivery leads in administering project management tools and managing all aspects of financials (monitoring of actuals vs plan, forecasting, processing of invoices)
  • Reconcile contractor cost recoveries in Planview/MIS to professional fee accrual during month-end at the contract and resource level
  • Support executive and portfolio level financial/KPI reporting
  • Automate existing reporting and enhance data visualization/analytics through various productivity tools (Tableau, VBA, etc); develop new automated solutions to improve productivity and efficiency
  • Maintain a healthy, accurate financial control environment within the Finance IT Business Management Office, reinforcing our role as the source of financial truth (App Dev, Maintenance, 3rd Party, NIE, etc)
  • Monitoring and communicating key performance metrics and operational challenges
  • Implement change management as required for new implementations and enhancements for project management tools

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Bachelor’s degree, with a focus in finance, accounting, computer science, business or mathematics.
  • Experience in a financial control environment
  • Data analytics and reporting experience on large data sets and multiple sources
  • Advanced command of Microsoft Excel, Word, Powerpoint, and data visualization tools
  • Basic financial services and accounting knowledge

Nice-to-have

Notes:

  • Previous experience with Tableau, SQL, Planview
  • Experience in an IT delivery team with a focus on project management, and the systems development lifecycle
  • CPA, PMP, MBA designation(s)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities          
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies
  • #LI-HYBRID
  • #LI-POST

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

item.title: Senior Officer, Data Management & Quality
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Officer, Data Management & Quality

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will be working as part of the Data Management & Quality team. The purpose of the role is to ensure that all Client and Product data is input, controlled effectively and maintained appropriately for all WMI businesses and product lines.

UKJERSEYWM

What will you do?

  • Ensure the integrity of data across and between multiple systems is maintained

  • Complete data maintenance and supporting administrative tasks throughout the Client and Product lifecycle

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure that all issues, queries and obstacles are satisfactorily resolved to ensure that tasks are completed in a timely and efficient manner

  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of an appropriate control environment in line with applicable data standards, regulatory requirements and business unit procedures

  • Contribute to the ongoing efficiency, innovations, process review and development of Data Management and Quality

  • Act as an SME to assist with Optimisation activities including the development of new RPA processes, Service Requests and core application development

  • Assist in the rotation and remediation of daily control reports and collation of task information for Management Information

  • Assist with the delivery and completion of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Post Implementation Verification (PIV) testing


What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Strong communication, influencing and negotiating skills

  • Collaborative and consultative approach along with team player attitude

  • Ability to make decisions, use initiative and escalate issues

  • Ability to execute tasks within defined service level agreements

  • A proven track record in excellent service delivery

  • Knowledge/experience with Client Due Diligence (CDD) / Know Your Client (KYC) and supporting documentation

  • Ability and willingness to work from home in line with the hybrid working team charter


Nice-to-have

  • An understanding of client structures, primarily companies and trusts

  • Knowledge of VB and macros

  • Knowledge/Understanding of JIRA

  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products — specifically Word and Excel

  • Knowledge and understanding of Salesforce, RIBS, Milvus, Triple A, 5 Series, and Content Navigator

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Flexible working options fully supported

item.title: Associate, Pricing
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate, Pricing

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Do you excel in a fast-paced environment? Are you detail-oriented, systems savvy and a strong communicator? As an Associate in the Office of the COO of Investor Services, you will be a valued member of RBC’s Investor Services (IS) group. Working in a strategic function, you will be part of a team that is responsible for supporting executives and business leaders in meeting IS objectives. You will support the Director, Pricing in providing a variety of value add pricing analysis to fuel growth. You will partner with a variety of internal stakeholders (Product, Business Development, Client Coverage, Strategy & Projects, Operations, and Senior Leadership) to provide comprehensive analysis, reporting and modeling services to facilitate profitable growth.

What will you do?

  • Work with the core pricing team, and key business partners, to prepare pricing models (for new prospects, contracts up for renewal etc.)
  • In partnership with various internal teams update standard rate cards and analyze the current revenue book to identify and follow-thru on re-pricing activities
  • Prepare internal analyses to enable decision-making related to businesses and markets that IS operates in
  • Provide a variety of routine, and ad-hoc, management reporting to Senior Leadership and others on the revenue book, product and activity cost
  • Help with a variety of systems and process improvement initiatives
  • Help promote a culture of integrity by promoting open, honest and transparent dealing in the day-to-day management and execution of pricing deliverables

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Undergraduate degree in business or commerce. CFA, CPA or MBA preferred
  • 2+ years experience in Investment Banking, Advisory, FP&A or similar roles
  • Strong proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel, Word and experience using data mining tools
  • Experience preparing materials and presentations for executive audiences
  • Experience synthesizing data from multiple sources into clear, articulate analyses and/or presentations
  • Ability to effectively manage competing timelines and priorities for multiple teams and across global time zones

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Excellent exposure to communicate with various business partners and stakeholders in Investor & Treasury Services and within other platforms as appropriate
  • Opportunity to obtain hands-on experience throughout your role
  • Working with an exciting, close-knit, supportive & dynamic group
  • Opportunity to collaborate with other business segments within the bank
  • Excellent career development and progression opportunities
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Competitive compensation

Job Summary

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada
